column5: We have two memebers of our group that have had DUI's. One was more than five years ago but less than 10 and the other was less than 5 years ago. I am looking for people's experiences since the new rules went into affect in March of 2012? The information at the links below seem pretty straight forward. I am looking for actual experience with this and how it went. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JqQIqKbV8H4http://noto.ca/bordercrossingThanks in advance for your help
We had one guy with a 9 yr old dui 2 weeks ago.We had all trp paperwork ready.They never asked one thing about it, and we were on our way.It was also a friday afternoon with no waiting lines.
Be sure they have bus fare home.
I also believe you can rent a car from the airport in I-Falls and drive home too

Do all the paperwork in advance, and have the approval in hand. Uncle had a DUI 6 or 7 years ago, got his paperwork a few months ago, and he was across the border in 5 minutes. I know a couple that tried to get approval at the border ( husband and wife had dui over 5 years ago). This let the "discretion of the agent" come into play. They were turned back.

Thanks Roscoe. This what I was looking for. The website and youtube video make it sound so easy. One of the them can apply for reabhilation and the other I think should just probably wait a few years.
How about a reckless op 13 years ago, a problem?
